message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.NE, cs.CV, cs.CL. 

The paper discusses methods for developing artificial intelligence applications capable of true lifelong learning, which is a topic that falls under the broad category of machine learning (cs.LG). The paper specifically focuses on addressing the issue of catastrophic forgetting, which is a common problem in neural networks used for continual learning, and proposes a new approach called generative replay with feedback connections. This approach involves using a generative model to replay previously learned tasks during training, and integrating the generative model into the main model using feedback connections to reduce computational cost. This approach is applicable to a wide range of AI applications, including natural language processing (cs.CL), computer vision (cs.CV), and neural networks (cs.NE). Finally, the paper evaluates the proposed approach using the split and permuted MNIST task protocols, which is a common benchmark for evaluating continual learning methods in the field of artificial intelligence (cs.AI).
